author: David Einstein
title: Apple’s Next Big Thing is mostly ‘meh’
text:
Photo: Lea Suzuki, The Chronicle 8602541|article-6499642|7 8602541|article-6499642|1 email_share_embed|photo-8602541|article-6499642|1 8602541|article-6499642|2 8602541|article-6499642|3 8602541|article-6499642|4 8602541|article-6499642|5 google_share_embed|photo-8602541|article-6499642|6 Tim Cook, chief executive officer of Apple Inc , holds the new iPad Pro during the Apple event at the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium on Wednesday, September 9, 2015 in San Francisco, Calif. Tim Cook, chief executive officer of Apple Inc , holds the new...
Apple’s theatrical product introductions have always had a surreal quality that lends them a circus-like atmosphere. When Steve Jobs was the CEO, they were the best show on Earth for Apple fans and the media that hung on his every word. Tim Cook, chief executive officer of Apple Inc , holds the new iPad Pro during the Apple event at the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium on Wednesday, September 9, 2015 in San Francisco, Calif.
